newsitem.title: UK: Hong Kong stocks firm in London.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong stocks firm in London.

text.p: Hong Kong shares were generally firm in London as gains in HSBC Holdings and Hong Kong Telecommunications Ltd dragged the broad market higher in thin trading, dealers said.
Shares got an additional boost after Wall Street recovered opening losses and turned higher, lifting London shares as well.
At 1439 GMT, the Hang Seng London Reference index was up 189.78 points to 13,930.08, a record high.
In Hong Kong, the Hang Seng index climbed 134.39 points to 13,740.
Hong Kong Telecom advanced in Hong Kong and gained further ground in London, after the company posted a 12.5 percent increase in its annual profits.
Speculation that a China partner might buy a stake in Hong Kong Telecom also bolstered the stock.
Shares in HSBC Holdings rallied in London on what dealers called a technical short squeeze.
"Those two stocks are helping the rest of the market," one said.
